meanings.definition: The quality of being able to be divided evenly.
meanings.sent1: The divisibility of the cake ensured that everyone got an equal slice.
meanings.sent2: Mathematics teaches us about the divisibility of numbers.
meanings.sent3: The divisibility of the pizza caused a friendly argument over who got the bigger slice.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness had a divisibility that made everyone feel included.
meanings.sent5: The divisibility of the puzzle pieces made it easy to put together.

meanings.definition: The property of a number being able to be divided by another number without leaving a remainder.
meanings.sent1: The divisibility of 10 by 2 means it can be evenly split into two groups of 5.
meanings.sent2: Understanding the divisibility of prime numbers is important in math.
meanings.sent3: The divisibility of the cookies by the number of kids led to a fair distribution.
meanings.sent4: His divisibility with different groups of friends showed his adaptability.
meanings.sent5: The divisibility of the rope made it easy to share among the team.
